intro: Antirrhinum hispanicum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a distinctive two-lipped structure. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves that are broader than those of the typical species. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens.
